# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

Here is a solution in Julia:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyymm"), df[:dt])
end

# Testing the function with given data
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This function uses the `map` function to apply a function to each element of a column. The function applied here is `Dates.format`, which formats a date as a string according to a format string. The "yyyymm" format string extracts the year and month from the DateTime object and concatenates them together.

The resulting DataFrame will have an additional column, `:ym`, containing the formatted DateTimes.
